summary: Fencing is a sport where people fight with swords called foils, épées, or sabres. Each type of sword has its own rules. Fencers usually specialize in one style. This sport became popular in the late 1800s and is based on old European sword fighting. Italian and French schools improved the techniques. In competitions, points are scored by touching the opponent. In the 1904 Olympics, there was a fourth discipline called singlestick, but it's not used now. Fencing has been in every modern Olympics, along with sports like athletics and swimming.
title: Fencing
